channel.title: Live Migration on Harvester manual test cases
channel.description: Recent content in Live Migration on Harvester manual test cases

item.description:
• Related issues: #1401 Http proxy setting download image

Environment setup

Setup an airgapped harvester

  1. Create an 3 nodes harvester cluster with large size disks

Verification Steps

Scenario2: Live migrate VM not have hot-plugged volume before, do hot-plugged the unplugged.
  1. Create a virtual machine
  2. Create several volumes (without image)
  3. Add volume, hot-plug volume to virtual machine
  4. Open virtual machine, find hot-plugged volume
  5. Click Detach volume
  6. Add volume again
  7. Migrate VM from one node to another
  8. Detach volume
  9. Add unplugged volume again

Expected Results

  1. Can hot-plug volume without error
  2. Can hot-unplug the pluggable volumes without restarting VM
  3. The de-attached volume can also be hot-plug and mount back to VM

item.title: Initiate multiple migrations at one time
item.description:
1. Initiate live migration for a vm.
  2. While the live migration is in progress, initiate another migration

Expected Results

  1. Both migration should work fine.
  2. The VMs should be accessible after the migration

item.title: Migrate a turned on VM from one host to another
item.description:
1. Create a new file on the machine
  2. Migrate the VM from one host in the cluster to another
  3. Connect via console
  4. Check for the file
  5. Change the file and save it
  6. Verify that you can close and open the file again

Expected Results

  1. File should create correctly
  2. VM should go into migrating status
  3. VM should go out of migrating status
  4. It should show the new node on the host column in the VM list
  5. It should have the same IP
  6. You should be able to edit and re-open the file

  4. It should show the new node on the host column in the VM list
  5. It should have the same IP
  6. You should be able to edit and re-open the file

item.title: Migrate to Node without replicaset
item.description:
1. Create a new VM on a 4 node cluster
  2. Check which nodes have copies of the replica set
  3. Migrate the VM to the host that does not have the volume

Expected Results

  1. VM should create correctly

item.title: Migrate VM from Restored backup
item.description:
Ref: https://github.com/harvester/harvester/issues/1086

Verify Items

  • VM can be migrate to any node with any times

Case: Migrate a restored VM

  1. Install Harvester with at least 2 nodes
  2. setup backup-target with NFS
  3. Create image for VM creation
  4. Create VM a
  5. Add file with some data in VM a
  6. Backup VM a as a-bak
  7. Restore backup a-bak into VM b
  8. Start VM b then check added file should exist with same content
  9. Migrate VM b to another node, then check added file should exist with same content
  10. Migrate VM b again, then check added file should exist with same content

item.title: Negative migrate a turned on VM from one host to another
item.description:
1. Migrate the VM from one host in the cluster to another
  2. Turn off/disconnect node while migrating

Expected Results

  1. Migration should fail
  2. You should get an error message in the status

item.title: Negative network disconnection for a longer time while migration is in progress
item.description:
1. Initiate VM migration
  2. While migration is in progress, disconnect network for 100 sec on the node where the VM is scheduled

Expected Results

  1. Migration should fail but volume data should be intact
  2. The VM should be accessible during the migration and should also be accessible once the migration fails

item.title: Negative network disconnection for a short time while migration is in progress
item.description:
1. Initiate VM migration.
  2. While migration is in progress, disconnect network for 5 sec on the node where the VM is scheduled

Expected Results

  1. Migration should resume once the network is up again
  2. The VM should be accessible during and after the migration

item.title: Negative node down while migration is in progress
item.description:
1. Initiate VM migration.
  2. While migration is in progress, shut the node where the VM is scheduled.
  3. After failure, initiate the migration to another node

Expected Results

  1. Migration should fail but volume data should be intact
  2. The VM should be accessible on older node
  3. The migration scheduled for another node should work fine
  4. The VM should be accessible during and after the migration

item.title: Negative node un-schedulable during live migration
item.description:
Prerequisite:

  1. Cluster is of 3 nodes.
  2. VM is running on Node-1
  3. Node-2 and Node-3 don’t have space to migrate a VM to them.

Steps:

  1. Create a vm on node-1
  2. Migrate the VM.

Expected Results

  1. Migration should not be started.
  2. Relevant error should be shown on the GUI.
  3. The existing VM should be accessible and the health check of the VM should be fine

item.title: Support volume hot plug live migrate
item.description:
• Related issues: #1401 Support volume hot-unplug

Category:

  • Storage

Environment setup

Setup an airgapped harvester

  1. Create an 3 nodes harvester cluster with large size disks

Verification Steps

Scenario2: Live migrate VM not have hot-plugged volume before, do hot-plugged the unplugged.
  1. Create a virtual machine
  2. Create several volumes (without image)
  3. Add volume, hot-plug volume to virtual machine
  4. Open virtual machine, find hot-plugged volume
  5. Click Detach volume
  6. Add volume again
  7. Migrate VM from one node to another
  8. Detach volume
  9. Add unplugged volume again

Expected Results

  1. Can hot-plug volume without error
  2. Can hot-unplug the pluggable volumes without restarting VM
  3. The de-attached volume can also be hot-plug and mount back to VM

item.title: Test aborting live migration
item.description:
1. On a VM that is turned on select migrate
  2. Start the migration
  3. Abort the migration

Expected Results

  1. You should see the status move to migrating
  2. You should see the status move to aborting migration
  3. You should see the status move to running
  4. The VM should pass health checks

item.title: Test zero downtime for live migration download test
item.description:
1. Connect to VM via console
  2. Start a large file download
  3. Live migrate VM to new host
  4. Verify that file download does not fail

Expected Results

  1. Console should open
  2. VM should start to migrate
  3. File download should

item.title: Test zero downtime for live migration ping test
item.description:
1. Continually ping VM
  2. Verify that ping is getting a response
  3. Live migrate VM to new host
  4. Verify that ping continues

Expected Results

  1. Ping should get response
  2. VM should start to migrate
  3. Ping should not get any dropped packets
